page.title: 02Landscape around Cliffe
page.content: The area is very flat. Most of the land is 7 or 8 metres above sea level, except in the south west corner of the block where it slopes down by about 3 metres towards the{River Ouse. The villages are built on the slightly higher ground inside the 8 metre contour. Nearly all the land is used for {arable farming,}but there seems to be a lot of{trees}in the area, because most fields have trees in the hedges. Some fields have two or three trees in the middle showing where hedges used to be. The only big{buildings}are the old maltings beside the railways. The most noticeable buildings are outside the survey area, Drax Power Station to the south, and Hemingbrough church spire to the south east.
